pattern.name: Concentration
pattern.description:
Any statistic (e.g. percentage of the most frequent value) calculated from the distribution of the nominal child field with child filter F.
NOTE: IT COULD WORK ON IDS.
pattern.example:
Concentration ratio of the credit bureau enquiries. In this case the child entity is enquiry and segmentor is credit grantor making the enquiry. Low values of concentration ratio indicate many credit grantors making enquiries and high credit risk.
A customer with high variety of transactions (withdrawal, transfer order, credit card...) is more likely to pay the loan in time.
pattern.author: Jan Motl
pattern.code: SELECT a.@base , 100.0 * count(CASE WHEN m."mode"=@column THEN 1 ELSE null END) / nullif(count(@column), 0) AS @columnName FROM @propagatedTable a JOIN (select @baseId , @baseDate , mode() within group (order by @column) AS "mode" FROM @propagatedTable GROUP BY @base ) m ON a.@baseId = m.@baseId AND a.@baseDate = m.@baseDate GROUP BY a.@base

SELECT a.@baseId , a.@baseDate , a.@baseTarget , 100.0 * count(CASE WHEN m."mode"=@column THEN 1 ELSE null END) / nullif(count(@column), 0) AS @columnName FROM @propagatedTable a JOIN (select @baseId , @baseDate , stats_mode(@column) AS "mode" FROM @propagatedTable GROUP BY @base ) m ON a.@baseId = m.@baseId AND a.@baseDate = m.@baseDate GROUP BY a.@base
